title: Strictly Katya's secret comments to Mike Bushell during Quickstep

Katya Jones has sent Twitter into meltdown as her exaggerated and over-the-top counting to Mike Bushell during their performance on Saturday night was exposed on tonight's Strictly Come Dancing results show.

As the judges discussed some of the dances from last night's show with host Claudia Winkleman, she revealed to Bruno that he wasn't the only one counting during Katya and Neil's Quickstep routine to Come on Eileen by Dexys Midnight Runners.

The results show replayed part of Katya and Neil's dance and uncovered their conversation as they performed the steps.

(Image: BBC)

Katya appeared to be loudly chanting the musical and dance counts to Mike in an encouragingly loud tone.

After speaking their intro line: "I feel like chips you Know, let's go get some chips", Katya continued to count "1, 2, 3, 4" and "run, run, run, hey!" loudly at her celeb partner Mike.

Twitter users fled to Twitter to comment on Katya's dramatic counting.

One user wrote: "Katya's screaming! No need."

While another shared: "Can Katya please tone it down a notch or two?!!"

(Image: DIGITAL/EROTEME.CO.UK)

A third added: "Katya needs to calm down, kinda fed up of her now."

Another added: "Can we get a warning before Katya screeeeeeeches so we can hit the mute button??? My fury is justified with their undeserved high score."

Last night, Katya was left incredibly emotional after she and BBC presenter Mike wowed the judges with their performance.

After receiving a nine from judge Motsi Mabuse, Katya couldn't contain the tears as they hugged tightly.

(Image: BBC)

As an inconsolable Katya was asked by Claudia Winkleman if she was alright, Mike kissed her on the cheek.

Grabbing him around the neck, she squealed: "I want to kiss him so much! He worked so hard!"

But eagle-eyed fans noticed the awkward reaction on Neil Jones' face in response to Katya's cringeworthy comment.

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

Tonight's results show was a shocker as the third celebrity to be booted off the show was revealed as radio DJ Dev Griffin and his professional partner Dianne Buswell.

Anneka Rice and Kevin Clifton received the lowest score last week and were voted off after scoring a total of 11 points for their Charleston to Woo Hoo from Kill Bill.

James Cracknell was the first celebrity to be voted off the popular BBC dance competition after struggling to impress on the dancefloor with his professional partner Luba Mushtuk .

*Strictly Come Dancing returns next Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC One
description: The pro dancer was heard dramatically chanting the dance counts in her celebrity partner Mike's ear during their comical Quickstep performance
